required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Gender Specific Differences of Saliva Composition on the Development of Dental Erosion - an In-situ Study
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Gender Specific Differences of Saliva Composition on the Development of Dental Erosion - an In-situ Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Healthy volunteers are observationally wearing an intraoral device with bovine tooth samples once for two hours. Afterwards, Calcium release from the bovine enamel and dentin samples is measured after extraoral erosion.
Total protein concentration within the formed salivary pellicles on the bovine samples is determined. Further Salivary parameters (unstimulated and stimulated saliva flow rate, pH, buffer capacity, albumin and total protein content as well as concentration of inorganic calcium, phosphate and fluoride) are being measured.
The aim of this study is to investigate whether gender differences in the salivary composition correlate with predisposition to erosion.

primary_outcome.measure: Calcium release from bovine enamel and dentin samples by extraoral erosion (mol/Square Centimeter).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after the intraoral device has been worn once for two hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of unstimulated and stimulated saliva flow rate (ml/min).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before wearing the intraoral device once for two hours.
Immediately before wearing the intraoral device once for two hours.
Immediately before wearing the intraoral device once for two hours.
Immediately before wearing the intraoral device once for two hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of total protein content (g/L) in saliva.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before wearing the intraoral device once for two hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of inorganic calcium, phosphate and fluoride (mol/mL) in saliva.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately before wearing the intraoral device once for two hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of total protein concentration in the formed salivary pellicles (mg/Sample).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after the intraoral device has been worn once for two hours.

intervention.intervention_name: Wearing of an intraoral device with bovine tooth samples
intervention.description: Wearing of an intraoral device with bovine tooth samples

biospec_descr.textblock: Saliva samples are obtained and retained for 10 years.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy probands aged between 20 and 40 years who are able to give written consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-fulfillment of the inclusion criteria
- Smoking
- Hyposalivation / xerostomia
- Intake of any medication (except contraceptives in women)
- Pregnant or lactating women
- Known allergies to substances used in the study
- Orthodontic treatment or malfunction which doesn't allow to wear an intraoral device

overall_official.last_name: Annette Wiegand, Prof. Dr. med. dent.
